content: Dear users, Please be informed and cautious that, CRED don't have mechanism to check the already paid bill. content: Hi Cred, I was very disappointed that you force the users to receive WhatsApp notifications from you! When you collect the phone number and email you can still contact customers via those channel, isn't it? If I rephrase the mandatory checkbox for consent, I read it as CRED will only work for customers who have and use WhatsApp! That is one thing that I do not like. It will be more mature if you decide to contact with simple and benign approaches like SMS, Email, and if you want to be savvy why not Tweet?! Yet you choose and insist on WhatsApp. I was captivated by your ad-campaign during IPL 2020 and liked the concept. But this mandatory thing put me off and I never went past that! So, I am not yet a user, but I am a fan who is at the verge of dropping out as nobody to you :) My intent is to pass this message, so I sit on the wall with 3-star rating :) I dont think scoring algorithms will pull your app score down because of this review. But please do not side on WhatsApp only communication !! Dough what happened with Emails? If you want to be savvy why not Tweet :) Sorry I know I repeated myself there. But, yes that is the sentiment.
replyContent: Hi Siva, thank you for your feedback. We would love to connect with you to understand what can be done to improve your experience even more. Request you to share your suggestions/concerns with us at pearl@cred.club, using your registered email address.

content: Though customer support is enthusiastic system has not developed properly. As per NPCI rule whenever there will be failure in a UPI Payment first level dispute can be raised through the TPAP. As CRED UPI is a part of CRED, a proper and separate dispute raising mechanism like other UPI apps should be there. Whenever TPAP is used for a UPI Payment banks don't take the liability or intrigue into failure reasons. That's why CRED UPI as a TPAP should develop a chargeback mechanism of its own

I started using this app one week back and the following are the pros and cons    Pros:  Awesome app. Seamless payment experience. Rewards process is good Idea of getting rewards to pay credit card bills is very good.  Cons:  UPI setup does not work. App wants to snoop on email and credit card statement (not mandatory).  The reward points seem useless since best rewards are for other currency which you get only when you refer someone (and they register and pay a credit card bill). The reward options are not good, 80% of stores are unheard of. Scratch cards hardly pay anything but cost a lot.   Customer care is non existent, available only through chat with one replies in half an hour. They never resolve any issue.  Very good idea but if there are no proper rewards people will move on
